universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Interface ErrorWidget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AutoCompleteTextViewWidget, EditLayout, EditTextWidget, EmptyView, InputLayout, SpinnerLayout, SpinnerWidget, TextViewWidget

    public interface ErrorWidget
    Interface for widget to which an error can be specified.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearError()
      Clears the current error of this widget (if any).
      CharSequence getError()
      Returns the error specified for this widget (if any).
      boolean hasError()
      Checks whether this widget has error specified or not.
      void setError(CharSequence error)
      Sets an error for this widget.

    • Method Detail

      • setError

        void setError(@NonNull
              CharSequence error)
        Sets an error for this widget. To clear the specified error, call clearError().

        Note, that presentation of the given error to a user depends on a specific implementation of this error widget. Some implementations may not event display this error, but each widget should at least create its Drawable state in View.onCreateDrawableState(int) with ui_state_error as extra state.

        Parameters:
        error - The desired error to be presented by this widget to the user.
        See Also:
        getError(), hasError(), clearError()

      • hasError

        boolean hasError()
        Checks whether this widget has error specified or not.
        Returns:
        True if error is specified, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setError(CharSequence), getError()

      • getError

        @Nullable
CharSequence getError()
        Returns the error specified for this widget (if any).
        Returns:
        This widget's error or null if there was no error specified yet or it has been cleared.
        See Also:
        setError(CharSequence), hasError()

      • clearError

        void clearError()
        Clears the current error of this widget (if any).
